sen.j: 三室戸寺（みむろとじ）は、京都府宇治市にある寺院。
sen.e: Mimuroto-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Mimuroto-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Mimuroto-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は明星山。
sen.e: The temple's honorific mountain prefix is Myojozan.
The temple's honorific mountain prefix is Myojozan.
The temple's honorific mountain prefix is Myojozan.

sen.j: 西国三十三箇所第10番札所。
sen.e: It is the 10th temple of the 33 Temple Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
It is the 10th temple of the 33 Temple Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
It is the 10th of the 33 temples that are visited during the Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
sen.cmt: 「西国三十三箇所」の訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 本山修験宗の別格本山。
sen.e: It is a Bekkaku Honzan (Extraordinary head temple) of Honzan Shugenshu sect.
It is a Bekkaku Honzan (Extraordinary head temple) of Honzan Shugenshu sect.
It is a Bekkaku Honzan (Extraordinary head temple) of Honzan Shugenshu sect.

sen.j: 光仁天皇の御願により奈良大安寺の僧行表が天平年間（729年～748年）の末期に創建したものと伝わる。
sen.e: The temple is said to have been founded by the monk Gyohyo between 729 and 748 at the request of Emperor Konin.
The temple is said to have been founded by the monk Gyohyo between 729 and 748 at the request of Emperor Konin.
Mimuroto-ji Temple is said to have been founded by the monk Gyohyo of Nara Taian-ji Temple at the request of Emperor Konin during the end of Tenpyo era (729 - 748).
sen.cmt: 「奈良大安寺の」「天平年間（729年～748年）の末期」の訳を補足しました。

sen.j: その後火災などを原因とする幾度もの移転を経て、文明年間（1469年～1486年）に今の所在地に再建された。
sen.e: It then went on to be relocated several times due to fires and other reasons before being rebuilt at its current location between 1469 and 1486.
It then went on to be relocated several times due to fires and other reasons before being rebuilt at its current location between 1469 and 1486.
It then went on to be relocated several times due to fires and other reasons before being rebuilt at its current location during 1469 - 1486.
sen.cmt: 「文明年間（1469年～1486年）」の訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 園城寺などの加勢を得るなかで格式高い天台寺院として栄えるも、室町中期に戦禍に遭って焼失。
sen.e: Mimuroto-ji Temple flourished as a high ranking Tendai Sect temple with the backing of temples such as Enjo-ji Temple, but became destroyed by fire amid conflict during the mid-Muromachi period.
Mimuroto-ji Temple flourished as a high ranking Tendai Sect temple with the backing of temples such as Enjo-ji Temple, but became destroyed by fire amid conflict during the mid-Muromachi period.
Mimuroto-ji Temple flourished as a high ranking Tendai Sect temple with the backing of temples such as Enjo-ji Temple, but became destroyed by war damages during the mid-Muromachi period.

sen.j: 再興されたたものの、しばし衰退の時を見る。
sen.e: Although it was later revived, it did have a brief period of decline.
Although it was later revived, it did have a brief period of decline.
Although it was later revived, it did have a brief period of decline.

sen.j: 天正元年(1573年)には織田信長と争った足利義昭に加勢したため焼き討ちされる。
sen.e: In 1573, the temple was set ablaze for supporting Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA who was in conflict with Nobunaga ODA.
In 1573, the temple was set ablaze for supporting Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA who was in conflict with Nobunaga ODA.
In 1573, the temple was set ablaze for supporting Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA who was in conflict with Nobunaga ODA.

sen.j: その後、江戸時代の後期にあたる文化11年（1814年）に、今に在る本堂が再建された。
sen.e: The current main hall was rebuilt in 1814, during the latter part of the Edo period,
The current main hall was rebuilt in 1814, during the latter part of the Edo period,
After that, the current main hall was rebuilt in 1814, during the latter part of the Edo period,

sen.j: 本堂
sen.e: Main hall
Main hall
Main hall

sen.j: 文化_(元号)2年（1805年）に再建された重層入母屋造の重厚な建物で、秘仏の金銅千手観音立像が安置されている。
sen.e: This robust multi-storey building with a hip-and-gable roof houses a gilt bronze standing statue of the thousand-armed Kannon, which is usually kept hidden from public view.
This robust multi-storey building with a hip-and-gable roof houses a gilt bronze standing statue of the thousand-armed Kannon, which is usually kept hidden from public view.

The main hall is a robust temple in the style of Juso Irimoya-zukuri (multi-storey building with a hip-and-gable roof), rebuilt in 1805, where a gilt bronze standing statue of Thousand Armed Kannon (or Deity of Mercy)) is placed, which is usually kept hidden from public view.
sen.cmt: 「rebuilt in 1805」を追加、「The main hall」を主語に全体を修正しました。

sen.j: 阿弥陀堂
sen.e: Amitabha hall
Amitabha hall
Amitabha hall

sen.j: 三重塔
sen.e: Three-storey pagoda
Three-storey pagoda
Three-storey pagoda

sen.j: 元禄17年（1704年）建立の全高16メートルの三重塔で、もともとは播磨国三日月町の高蔵寺にあったものを、明治43年（1910年）に当寺が買い取って参道西方の丘上に移設。
sen.e: This 16 meter tall three-storey pagoda erected in 1704 originally stood at Kozo-ji Temple in Mikazukicho, Harima Province before being purchased by Mimuroto-ji Temple and relocated to the top of a hill to the north of the temple approach.

This 16 meter tall three-storey pagoda erected in 1704 originally stood at Kozo-ji Temple in Mikazukicho, Harima Province before being purchased by Mimuroto-ji Temple and relocated to the top of a hill to the north of the temple approach.

This three-storey pagoda, 16 meters tall, erected in 1704 originally stood at Kozo-ji Temple in Mikazuki-cho, Harima Province, before being purchased by Mimuroto-ji Temple and relocated to the top of the hill to the west of the temple approach in 1910.
sen.cmt: 「in 1910」を追記、「全高16メートルの三重塔」の部分の表現を変更し、「Mikazukicho」→「Mikazuki-cho」「north of」→「west of」としました。

sen.j: その後境内の現所在地（鐘楼の東隣）に移された。
sen.e: It was later moved to its current location (on the eastern side of the belfry.
It was later moved to its current location (on the eastern side of the belfry.
It was later moved to its current location (on the eastern side of the belfry) inside the temple's grounds.
sen.cmt: 「境内の」の訳を補足しました。

sen.j: 庭園
sen.e: Garden
Garden
Garden

sen.j: 5000坪の広さがあり、枯山水・池泉・広庭からなる。
sen.e: The 16,550m² garden consists of dry landscapes, ponds and springs and a wide garden.
The 16,550m² garden consists of dry landscapes, ponds and springs and a wide garden.
The 16,550 square meters' garden consists of Karesansui (dry landscape style), ponds, springs and a wide garden.
sen.cmt: 「m²」→「square meters」とし「Karesansui」を補足しました。「池泉」は「池泉回遊式庭園」を、また「広庭」は「石庭」を指すと思われますが、原文どおり訳出してあるので、ほぼそのままです。参考：三室戸寺HP（http://www.mimurotoji.com/article.php?id=230）

sen.j: 5月は2万株のツツジ、一千本のシャクナゲ、6月は1万株のアジサイ、7月はハス、さらに秋は紅葉の名所にもなる。
sen.e: It is known for its 20,000 azaleas and 1,000 rhododendrons that come into bloom in May, the 10,000 Japanese hydrangeas that bloom in June, the lotus flowers that bloom in July and renowned for its beautifully colored autumn leaves.

It is known for its 20,000 azaleas and 1,000 rhododendrons that come into bloom in May, the 10,000 Japanese hydrangeas that bloom in June, the lotus flowers that bloom in July and renowned for its beautifully colored autumn leaves.

It is known for its 20,000 azaleas and 1,000 rhododendrons that come into bloom in May, the 10,000 Japanese hydrangeas that bloom in June, the lotus flowers that bloom in July and renowned for its beautifully colored autumn leaves.
